summary: The 'Better Availability of Birth Centers Improves Outcomes and Expands Savings Act' (BABIES Act) aims to address maternity care shortages by expanding access to birth centers. It proposes grants for birth center start-up or expansion in underserved areas and establishes a Medicaid demonstration program to explore effective payment models for birth center care. The bill seeks to improve the quality of care and potentially reduce costs, focusing on low-risk pregnancies.
